title: Welcome to Mechs vs. Minions
body:
Howdy,

Welcome to the boards for 'Mechs vs. Minions'.

If you've found your way here, then I'm sure you know how boards work - we'll try to limit most of the chatter here to boardgame related stuff.  The crew that worked on MvM aren't as keyed into the latest on balance changes or the movings and shaking of the e-sports scene or whatnot.  But we'd be happy to chat with you about MvM, talk about our process (and occasionally, lack thereof), or provide whatever insight we can as to what we've made and why we've made it.  Rules questions that crop up; that type of thing.

But for now, I just wanted to say thanks for stopping by. 

-Kades

replies.body:
Well, congratulate everyone on finally making the "s" real in "Riot Game**s**."

First, why a "board game?" instead of something on computer.

Secondly, will this break my budget (either in terms of money or time)?

>Well, congratulate everyone on finally making the "s" real in "Riot Games."

{{champion:53}} {{summoner:31}}

And let's not forget the best game of all:

{{champion:432}}

Hey TerraRising! Mechs Vs Minions will be available exclusively on the merch store at riotgames.com and retails at $75.00 plus shipping. There are 10 replay-able missions that last somewhere between 60-90 minutes each. So you should be able to play multiple in a day if you are up for it!
Just watched the videos on Youtube, looks fun!  How long has the game been in development?
Almost three years!
Wow!  How big is the team?

The team definitely grew over the years (I think it started with two guys and an idea, tucked away in a meeting room in the old office), but I'd say the core team is about 15 people, including designers, artists, publishing, development, etc.

This game looks cool as hell ! 

Could u explain to me how you went through the development of this game ? Would be awesome !

And also, do u plan of keeping this game updated with extra cards at some events or smth or no ?

GJ team

Mr Piddlesworth and Kades can speak in more detail, but at it's core, we had an idea, made it playable, figured out what wasn't fun and what was, then tried to improve it. Rinse and repeat over the next 3 years. Find an incredible artist to make the gameplay come to life. Run hundreds of playtests and get more feedback. Iterate. Panic. Question every design decision we've made. Get more feedback. Panic slightly less. More feedback, more polish and more iteration, until we made something we were happy with. Ultimately, we hope it's something you enjoy. We had an amazing time making it :)

As for future updates, we're not sure about that right now. If there are cool stories to explore in this part of Runeterra, maybe we'll return, but for the time being, the game is complete.

Above all, thanks for being so excited. We hope it lives up to your expectations!

I like the idea of the game and as a Heimerdinger main I appreciate seeing more of him, what I can't stand though is how the lore has been bastardized to fit the setting for this game.

"Rumble has invited four intrepid yordles to **his school** to program and pilot their newly crafted mechs..."

Ok. Firstly, the lore behind Rumble in association to the Yordle Academy of Science states that "(...)Rumble refused to go. He believed that Heimerdinger and his associates were 'sellouts'..." Rumble chose to forego the best possible engineering education due to the fact that he saw the professors as "sellouts", now why in the world would he form a school? (I'd like to point out that Ziggs is technically titled "Dean of Demolitions", I'd even wager that Ziggs would be more likely than Rumble to have a proper school)

Secondly, I understand that Ziggs and Tristana are friends of Rumble in the LoL canon, but Corki and Heimerdinger would both be considered by Rumble to be part of the "enlightened" class of yordle educators whom he looks down on.

Third, there seems to be some clear design similarities between the outfits worn by Corki and Heimerdinger to Heim's own contraptions. The other two mechs are clearly constructed by Rumble since Ziggs is infamous for his explosive contraptions not performing as intended, and Tristana doesn't have a proper background in engineering. So my question is, are we to assume that Heimerdinger and Corki are riding in blatantly plagiarized inventions? I find it hard to believe that as scatter-brained as Heimerdinger is, he should easily be able to tell when his designs are being re-used and modified.

This isn't the Yordle Academy! Rumble wouldn't stoop to going back there. This is his own school in his own junkyard!

Rumble doesn't really like Heimerdinger, and is probably ambivalent towards Corki, but he needed some way to convince Tristana to come to his new school so he can try to woo her. Inviting the other Yordles makes an excellent cover.

so basically....

https://cdn.meme.am/instances/67239909.jpg

The way I see it, this is Rumble's way of "getting back" at the institutions he disdains. He started his own school and got Heimerdinger to be HIS student!

But calling Rumble's school "proper" might be a bit over-generous. :)
the RITOPLS easter egg on the tutorial video :D
That's not the only easter egg in the game... not by a long shot.
Woah, sounds complicated. Does this game have a difficult learning curve, or could I open it and start playing pretty quickly?

The game starts off pretty simple, and there is a quick video tutorial up on youtube to give you an idea of the basics. You can start playing pretty quickly, though, because each scenario introduces the rules you need for that scenario. So to start you just need to read the short tutorial rules and you're ready to go. Each mission adds a little bit more. If you want more explanation of any rules, there is a rules reference book, too, so you don't have to go hunting for the scenario where the rule first appeared.
I see, so the rules get more complex with each scenario? That sounds pretty neat!
We tried to keep each mission feeling fresh with something new... sometimes rules, sometimes goals... adding a little more each time. My recommendation... don't jump ahead!
By the way on the official MvsM page it says the game comes with 5 mechs, not 4
The 5th mech is a secret minion mech I think.  Possibility that the minions stole Rumble's mech and re-purposed it for their own devious plans!
Interesting theory you've got there. {{champion:68}}

First off, this game looks amazing visually! I cant wait to get my hands on it!! My big question though, is this game going to be flexible enough for custom missions?  I understand the main missions may be repayable, but to me, it looks like a big fan could write new missions on their own to add more value to the game.  I guess this could almost be looked at similarly to how D&D has its players create their own stories, at least how I was thinking.

I've told Kades this a lot, but one of the things I'm most excited about is what our players do with the modular boards and pieces. There's a lot of incredibly creative folks out there and the game has enough core mechanics that you guys can draw inspiration from them to create your own! We also tested out a lot of stuff that we couldn't get to work and play well, so I'm hopeful others can take their own ideas and try stuff out!
Meeeeibe, and just meeeibe, add the possibility to receive blank cards to customize, at some point or another?

This is a great idea!!!! I don't think we offer blank cards, but you might be able to print your own on card stock and shuffle it into the deck! (Sleeving your cards might help with this, but I don't know how that would impact storage. Your milage may vary!)

If you do this, please send us pictures!

Yes i was talking about using sleeves and such, since something more elaborate might be too much off.

However, how are the cards compared to, for example, the ones like Magic? Or what are their format in general, if i missed the info? by the look of it they seem a lot more thick, and in stores it might be hard to find sleeves of different format.

I believe the cards are the same size as magic cards. You should have no trouble finding sleeves that fit. For most of the prototype and play test periods we were using printed cards in magic-card sized sleeves.
Does Heimerdinger get a bonus if anything happens that has to do with the number 42?

Congrats on marketing and gameplay win so far from what I can see. Can you please ensure each account can only buy 1 copy so that hoarders/touts won't be buying dozens/hundreds on release date in order to resell? Thanks

First off, this looks awesome!

Secondly, how long will this be available?  I probably won't  be able to get this until Christmas, so is this gonna to be one run that sells out or will there still be copies available in December?
I am 100% buying this for me and my local friends to play
There's one thing i'd like to ask: does 2-4 players mean 2 OR 4 players, or is the game playable with only 3 players?
2, 3 or 4 players are all valid. Some of the play testers preferred 2-3 players, in fact, because you can take the turns quicker and you power up faster.

Has the LoL playtest team ever touched this game?

Or are you guys totally separate from LoL?
Oh yeah, the play test team beat the heck out of MvM. In fact they were instrumental in creating the "Hard Mode" for Game+

The LoL play test team was actually a great help during the development of the game. They helped identify which commands were OP, which were weak and needed a boost... and they helped us balance the missions so they were tough, but winnable. In fact, the play test crew was instrumental in developing "Hard Mode" which unlocks after you've beaten the last mission.

Members of the playtest team provided lots of good playtesting help (along with lots and lots of other Rioters). 
However, for the most part, our teams are pretty separate.
Hi, Will it be possible to buy this game form South Africa. What will the cost be?

Will this game only be sold in NA? I've noticed there's no EUW website for this and I haven't found the price in euro. Does that mean I have to buy the game in the US store and pay tons of fees for shipping?
The game will also be available for purchase in the EU merch store.

Awesome! Super excited. 

Do you guys expect to have enough inventory for this? I'm wondering if I need to be ready to go to buy one right at the release time?

Guessing how many we'd need for the first wave has been tough, since we've never done anything like this before. We decided to err on the side of having too many, but there is the always the chance that still isn't enough. In that case we'll try to get more printed as quickly as possible.

{{champion:72}} Idk guys, for a while I was pretty okay with them just having one game....


In all seriousness though, this looks AWESOME, good work Riot :P

Will this game be available on the Riot Games Merchandise for Europe at the same day (it is 13.10.2016) or will it be some days/weeks later?

Edit: And another question - is this game to be limited quantities?

We're doing a simultaneous release in Europe and NA, so they should be available at the same from the merch store on 10/13. The initial wave is going to be 30,000 units in English and simplified Chinese, but you'll be able to download all the rulebooks and mission dossiers in multiple languages from the website.

Do you plan to release the game in other languages? I would love to get it, as I often meet friends to play tabletop games, but I don't think my friends would want to play with the game in english :( .

If you check out the website you can download the rulebook in multiple languages (just click on the download link and you'll get a zip with all of them). We'll also have the mission dossiers available there eventually as well. Currently for the physical product we are going to launching in two languages - English and simplified Chinese.
